HDG.WM.content: originary anxiety usually repressed (niedergehalten), anxiety is there, is sleeping, its breath quivers perpetually through Dasein > daring ones [embrace] anxiety, sustained by that one which they expend themselves > anxiety [?] stands outside of all opposition [anxiety as indifference point?], there’s cheerfulness, gentleness, creative longing
HDG.WM.linkedContent: originary anxiety usually repressed (niedergehalten), anxiety is there, is sleeping, its breath quivers perpetually through Dasein > daring ones [embrace] anxiety, sustained by that one which they expend themselves > anxiety [?] stands outside of all opposition [anxiety as indifference point?], there’s cheerfulness, gentleness, creative longing

HDG.IWM.content: [standing in that which folds you out] [great summary of existence of Dasein] withstanding (Ausstehen), as care, essence of ecstasis to be thought here, a “standing out” where “out” should be understood in terms of the “outside itself” of openness of Being itself > stasis of the ecstatic (as strange as it sounds): standing in the “out” and “there” of unconcealedness, prevails as essence of Being itself > replace “existence” w/ “in-standing (Inständigkeit)”
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: [standing in that which folds you out] [great summary of existence of Dasein] withstanding (Ausstehen), as care, essence of ecstasis to be thought here, a “standing out” where “out” should be understood in terms of the “outside itself” of openness of Being itself > stasis of the ecstatic (as strange as it sounds): standing in the “out” and “there” of unconcealedness, prevails as essence of Being itself > replace “existence” w/ “in-standing (Inständigkeit)”

HDG.QB.content: reciprocal exchange of rationalism/irrationalism [domination of ratio] denies possibility of thought outside this alternative > such a thinking could be prepared by tentative steps [not there yet, telos] of historical elucidation, reflection, discussion
HDG.QB.linkedContent: reciprocal exchange of rationalism/irrationalism [domination of ratio] denies possibility of thought outside this alternative > such a thinking could be prepared by tentative steps [not there yet, telos] of historical elucidation, reflection, discussion

HDG.QB.content: overcoming nihilism not standing outside of nihilism if essence of nihilism isn’t nihilistic, if history of that essence is older and remains younger [than phases of nihilism]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: overcoming nihilism not standing outside of nihilism if essence of nihilism isn’t nihilistic, if history of that essence is older and remains younger [than phases of nihilism]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig

HDG.FS.content: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans
HDG.FS.linkedContent: difficult to accomplish anew what Greeks did when they thought Being as an appearing outside concealment (phusis), still we ask: what occurs in fact of arising-into-alētheia? > the overabundance (Überfülle), the excess (Übermass) of what presences (Anwesende), thus why Thales can only look to the heavens, relation to this thrust of presence is thaumazein [wonder] [height & excess] > in extreme opposition, when astronauts landed on moon, moon as moon disappeared, only a calculable parameter (Rechnungsgrösse) for technological enterprise of humans

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.FS.content: when Heidegger looks at inkwell, does so w/out reference to hyletic data and categories, he undergoes fundamental experience w/ thing itself [outside consciousness but still moral image of thought?] > “being” in Da-sein says being-outside-of [vs. being in of consciousness], must preserve an “outside,” thus ek-stasis > Dasein rigorously means: ek-statically being there (immanence is broken) > from ek-stasis to instancy in the clearing (Inständigkeit in der Lichtung) [the turn?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when Heidegger looks at inkwell, does so w/out reference to hyletic data and categories, he undergoes fundamental experience w/ thing itself [outside consciousness but still moral image of thought?] > “being” in Da-sein says being-outside-of [vs. being in of consciousness], must preserve an “outside,” thus ek-stasis > Dasein rigorously means: ek-statically being there (immanence is broken) > from ek-stasis to instancy in the clearing (Inständigkeit in der Lichtung) [the turn?]

HDG.CCP.content: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: non-willing: 1) willingly to renounce willing 2) what remains absolutely outside any kind of will > these 2 stand in definite relation to each other > what moves our conversation claims my attention, challenges me

HDG.WL.content: whenever we’re listening, we’re letting something be said to us: all conception/perception already contained in that act [quasi-Derridean, nothing outside the text]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: whenever we’re listening, we’re letting something be said to us: all conception/perception already contained in that act [quasi-Derridean, nothing outside the text]

HDG.EC.content: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the most difficult: to advise those affected by devastation w/out paternalism (Bevormundung), or haughtiness, prepare them for meditation required to become familiar w/ devastation as event that prevails outside human guilt (Schuld)/atonement (Sühne)

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary
HDG.EC.linkedContent: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must be squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: free of standpoints only when there’s nothing to be done—but what if we have to look at things/research them? > free-standing detached standpoint = ruin of being-a-subject [is that now affirmative?] > developing our standpoint prior on the level of being > even unbiased seeing is a seeing, has a position in distinctive manner (appropriated so that it’s critically purged [kritischgereinigten]) > [so that an affirmative “freedom of standpoints” would be] an explicit (ausdrückliche) appropriation of our position of looking (Aneignung des Blickstandes), a position that is historical, not a chimerical in-itself outside of time
